page.title: 02POST WAR
page.content: After the building of the Cornish Unit houses at the end of WW2 residential building was arrested until the construction of a{sewage {disposal}plant in the mid 1960's. Since that time six small housing estates have been developed. Except for the almost continuous holiday traffic along Queen St. during the summer holidays the town has an air of tranquillity. There is some evidence that the town is slowly becoming a tourist attraction and the River Fowey provides recreation and fishing for salmon, trout, bass, and mullet. {Restormel Castle,}to the west of the area is an additional attraction.
